channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Registrar: Add/Drop (No W Grade) Deadline is January 20
item.description: The Registrar’s Office reminds students that the Spring 2025 add/drop (no W grade) deadline is January 20, 2025; students will be able to drop courses after this date, but will be issued a W grade. More detailed add/drop information is available via the Registrar’s Office website.
item.author: Students

item.title: Attention, Meal Plan Holders!
item.description: Did you know you can dine at any resident dining hall? Enjoy a meal swipe at the Commons Dining Hall, Russell Sage Dining Hall, or Blitman Dining Hall during operational hours!
item.author: Students

item.title: Enjoy “Coffee and Art” on January 17!
item.description: Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. Stop by to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects!
item.author: Students

item.title: First Part of Student MHFA Certification Training Being Offered January 24
item.description: Date: Friday, January 24, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Mueller Center Campus Recreation and Wellness team will be offering Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) certification trainings for students. If you have questions about this event, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Spring 2025 URP Applications Now Being Accepted
item.description: The Office of Undergraduate Education is currently accepting Undergraduate Research Program (URP) applications for the Spring 2025 semester! Full- and part-time undergraduate students may pursue research for academic credit or as a paid research assistant. Visit Undergraduate Research Program for more information. Application deadline is Monday, January 20, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Multimedia Services Announces Increase of Webex Personal Storage Limit
item.description: The personal storage limit for meeting recordings in Webex has increased from 30GB to 40GB for all users of the Webex platform. This limit ensures the optimal performance and availability of Webex to the entire Rensselaer community. Learn more. Any questions, please submit a support request.
item.author: Community

item.title: 15 New Employees Join RPI in December
item.description: Please give a warm welcome to the 15 new employees who started at RPI in December. Congratulations to each of them on their new roles — we’re excited to see their contributions to our community!
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Faculty Recognized with CAREER Award
item.description: ECSE Assistant Professor Dr. Liu Liu has received an NSF CAREER award from the Division of Computing and Communication Foundations (CCF) for his project, “CAREER: Elastic Algorithm-Architecture Co-Design for Energy-Efficient and Scalable AI via Dynamic Connectivity.” Dr. Liu’s research aims to reduce AI’s rapidly growing energy footprint by rethinking how AI hardware processes, stores, and transfers data.
item.author: Community

item.title: Bay Area RPI School of Architecture Alumni Experience to be Held January 27
item.description: School of Architecture alumni are invited to attend the first-ever Bay Area RPI School of Architecture Alumni Experience, scheduled to be held from 6PM to 8PM on Monday, January 27, 2025, when Chuck Oraftik ’66 has graciously arranged for attendees to gather at his former firm, HOK Inc., in San Francisco. Space is limited; RSVP ASAP and no later than January 20, 2025!
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Slated for January 17
item.description: Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - RSVP to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Attendees can expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Forged by Fire” Event Highlights Story of the Pittsburgh Building
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 7:00 PM - 8:15 PM - In honor of RPI’s Bicentennial Celebration, the Pittsburgh Alumni Chapter, led by Robert Douglass ’76, ’77G, has researched and captured the history of the Pittsburgh Building! Attend this virtually-hosted session to hear the motivation behind — and the enduring legacy of — the early Pittsburgh-based graduates who left an indelible gift to the students and spirit of the Institute. This event will also include a Q&A discussion.
item.author: Community

item.title: Collegiate Store Holding Spring 2025 Backpack Sale Through January 24
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store will be holding its Spring 2025 Backpack Sale January 7-24. Stop by and enjoy 20% off select non-imprinted backpacks in the store!
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Scores 4-1 Victory Over Nationally-Ranked Clarkson
item.description: Last weekend, Rensselaer’s men’s hockey team upset #19 Clarkson at the host team’s Cheel Arena up in Potsdam, New York. Dovar Tinling registered two goals during the game, while Nathan Sullivan and Jake Gagnon netted one score each toward the Engineers’ victory.
item.author: Community

item.title: 24th Sydney Archer Lecture in Organic & Medicinal Chemistry Scheduled for January 21
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 21, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Department of Chemistry’s 24th Sydney Archer Lecture in Organic & Medicinal Chemistry will feature Professor Richard B. Silverman from Northwestern University who will speak on the topic “Novel GABA Aminotransferase and Ornithine Aminotransferase Inactivators as Potential New Treatments for Epilepsy, Pain, and Hepatocellular Carcinoma.” All are invited; refreshments will be available at 3:45 PM.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Tips for Incorporating Digital Story Telling as Assignments” to be Topic of Faculty/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description: Date: Monday, January 27, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Maureen Fodera, of the Office of Undergraduate Education, for a workshop that will discuss a high overview of the meaning of digital story telling, its advantages, and story-telling assignment practices, as well as review the Six-Word Story, Six Unique Shots assignment concept.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Last Call: HelioCampus Virtual Syllabus Assistance Being Offered January 17
item.description:
Date: Friday, January 17, 2025 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Per requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by January 20, 2025. Those needing HelioCampus syllabus assistance may contact Learning Assessment Specialist Amy Svirsky.
